message_1: Determine whether the function f(n) = 2n + 3 is computable or not.
message_2: The function f(n) = 2n + 3 is computable. A function is computable if there exists an algorithm or a step-by-step procedure that can be followed to compute the function for any given input. In this case, the function f(n) is a simple linear function, and its computation involves basic arithmetic operations (multiplication and addition). Given any input n, you can compute the function by multiplying n by 2 and then adding 3 to the result.
